column4: WTF?!?! I just sshed into my ubuntu box and I get a big list of : -bash: /dev/null: Permission denied PLEASE HELP!
ok looks like Im finally getting off ubuntu's terrible terrible support and moving to debian
did your problem statement somehow get missed in the flurry?
I say again: did your problem statement somehow get missed in the flurry? maybe you could restate it
I just sshed into my ubuntu box after a reboot and I get a big list of : -bash: /dev/null: Permission denied
you're way above my head, but one suggestion - have you pastebinned the output? maybe someone who knows more about ssh and the necessary permissions on the host can look it over.
theres nothing to pastebin - I just get this line multiple times
I'm n00b enough that I don't know what you're expecting to see
I see.. Im expecting to see a shell
I assume the target box has to run some daemon that accepts connections from ssh client?
of course
sorry, I know that sounds basic as can be ... you've checked that the thing *is* running?
if it wouldnt be running, I wouldnt be able to give my user and pass...
the default shell on the target box -- bash or dash?
what the hell is dash?
dash is the default shell in, I think, Edgy and above -- sometimes it makes a difference, esp when some person or process expects bash instead
well I never even heard of dast so I doubt thats what I had
is the target box running Ubuntu? if so which version?
obviously, or I wouldnt be asking in #ubuntu... it's 7.04 - nm though - I managed to set 0666 permissions to /dev/null via webmin and it solved the problem
glad you resolved it - obviously.
thanks..
you too
